page.title: 06Mobile Library, Tongue
page.content: A Mobile Library van comes to Tongue on a Monday once a fortnight. The children from the school went to find out what people thought about the service. Of those interviewed, more did not use the library than did, but of those who found time to read, most thought the librarian helpful and the selection of books quite adequate. Once a fortnight was reckoned to be about right. The library van also calls at the school so that the children can make their own selection of books there. The nearest library building is in Thurso 45 miles away.
